page.title: 19CAISTOR DUCK FARM
page.content: Cherry valley,the world's largest duck farm, was set up by{Sir Joseph {Nickerson}in 1960,occupying a disused R.A.F.station on Kelsey Rd.Six hundred local people are employed &{seven {million ducks are killed every year. Special breeds have been developed that mature to different weights and have a higher proportion of meat to fat.Ducks and duck eggs are exported to over 56 countries & the firm recently won the{Queen's Award to {Industry.}Every part of the duck is used:feathers for duvets,tongues and feet are exported to the far east. Cherry valley supply the ducks for Marks & Spencers,Concorde and the QE 2 Cherry Valley was visited by the Chinese Minister of Agriculture,Mr.He Kang, in July on completion of another big export order to China,indicating the firm trading relations with China.
